TopicTitle: [WIP] Science Parts - Multi-Lense Camera Array - Science Drill [08-03-14]

Articles.Content:
This is the test threat for my next release. Currently there are 3 parts in testing:

New: Multi-Lense Camera Array - Take thousands of high-def pictures at different wavelengths in mere seconds. Great at analyzing biomes from low orbit. Can also be used to take more general surveys from higher orbits.

2.5 m materials bay - works exactly as the normal materials bay, but fits on 2.5 m rockets

Radial core sample drill - This works while the ship is landed and drills into the planet to retrieve a core sample. Currently it gives the same amount of science as a surface sample. It comes with it's own science descriptions and grants you additional science points. Any ideas how to tweak that value would be appreciated. Same goes for weight and where to place it in the tech tree. Note: The drill is reusable, so you can use it to prospect several biomes without having to haul several drills at once.

If you like the parts, please give me feedback. The current placement of the parts in the tech tree is still very WIP, as are the science values and the weight. Love me some feedback.

Here's the link: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/6d16jpngjyd4uma/PlaCoSciencev3.rar?dl=1&token_hash=AAETMktTIqyV4bD3YNreOZPoUjXHZgjC8SD9EtttIWP63Q

Edited March 8, 2014 by Yorik

Any chance of making a 0.625m materials bay? Maybe make it longer, but skinnier, than the stock one? That's the ONE part I hate the most in it's stock format, and I haven't found any really good way to carry multiples other than in an inline configuration... which is a pain for rough terrain landings.

That's why I made the 2.5 m variant. They stack quite nicely, but you need a bigger lander. I'm also thinking about making a goo container that has the same dimensions as the parachute for the 2.5m capsule(the big chute/drag chute).

Edited January 28, 2014 by Yorik

OK, just took it for a spin... That core sample drill is one sharp looking piece of hardware! I'm really liking it.

The materials bay looks pretty good too. Both look ready to be released, IMO.

Holy Crap dude the drill piece is awesome!!!!

Am I right in thinking that the drill was designed for use with the WIP Orbital Manufacturing mod?

Yes, that's correct. There hasn't been much progress on that mod.

But I thought that it would be a shame not to use the model at all.

Yes, that's correct. There hasn't been much progress on that mod.

But I thought that it would be a shame not to use the model at all.

Well put.

The tech requirement for the drill is basic rocketry. Seeing as it's purpose is for proves to be able take surface samples, perhaps it would be better to introduce it at the same level as some of the probe bodies? Just a thought.

It doesn't take surface samples. It takes core samples, which can be taken while landed, yes, but they are distinct from surface samples. I even wrote new science texts for all the biomes.

Edited January 30, 2014 by Yorik

It doesn't take surface samples. It takes core samples, which can be taken while landed, yes, but they are distinct from surface samples. I even wrote new science texts for all the biomes.

Dear god I am so sorry!

I was unaware. I was under the impression this was for unmanned surface samples.

My humble apologies good sir.

hey wait i recognize that isn't that (the core sample) from the orbital construction thread a while back

Just a small headsup, I found to spelling errors in your science definitions. The runway definition has "furing" instead of "during", and Ike says "Th" instead of "The".

Hope these help.

Thank you very much, I'll fix that for the next release.

And yes, that drill was originally designed for another mod. Since that mod has gone nowhere, I started using the parts for other things. No idea where to go with this though:

It was supposed to be the construction part for the orbital construction mod, but now... no idea. Some sort of atmospheric scanner maybe?

Right now I'm going for drying rack...

I have just the use for it: solar particle collector/analyzer. you deploy it and it generates a magnetic field that "steers" particles into the central sensor/collector. stick it onto a satellite to generate SCIENCE!

or... maybe a comms antenna, stick it on the end of a telescoping mast at your base and it swivels to point at a target you tell it to.

also, could be part of an emergency "faraday shield" deployed by your vessel during solar storms. use any or none of these ideas as you see fit, i hereby relinquish any and all claim to them and place them in the public domain for use by all.

v3 release: New science part(Multi-Lense Camera Array), some minor bug fixes & corrected typos, slightly adjusted science values.
